segment.source: Create an application to deploy with Windows 10 using Configuration Manager (Windows 10)
segment.target: Create an application to deploy with Windows 10 using Configuration Manager (Windows 10)

segment.source: Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager supports deploying applications as part of the Windows 10 deployment process.
segment.target: Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager supports deploying applications as part of the Windows 10 deployment process.

segment.source: Create an application to deploy with Windows 10 using Configuration Manager
segment.target: Create an application to deploy with Windows 10 using Configuration Manager

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager supports deploying applications as part of the Windows 10 deployment process.
segment.target: Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager supports deploying applications as part of the Windows 10 deployment process.

segment.source: In this section, you create an application in System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager that you later configure the task sequence to use.
segment.target: In this section, you create an application in System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager that you later configure the task sequence to use.

segment.source: For the purposes of this topic, we will use CM01, a machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard that is a member of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.
segment.target: For the purposes of this topic, we will use CM01, a machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard that is a member of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.

segment.source: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.
segment.target: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Even though the new application model is fully supported to deploy via the task sequence, the most reliable way to deploy software via the task sequence is still the legacy packages, especially if you deploy many applications.
segment.target: Even though the new application model is fully supported to deploy via the task sequence, the most reliable way to deploy software via the task sequence is still the legacy packages, especially if you deploy many applications.

segment.source: Example: Create the Adobe Reader XI application
segment.target: Example: Create the Adobe Reader XI application

segment.source: The steps below show you how to create the Adobe Reader XI application.
segment.target: The steps below show you how to create the Adobe Reader XI application.

segment.source: This section assumes that you have downloaded the MSI version of Adobe Reader XI to the C:SetupAdobe Reader XI folder on CM01.
segment.target: This section assumes that you have downloaded the MSI version of Adobe Reader XI to the C:SetupAdobe Reader XI folder on CM01.

segment.source: On CM01, using File Explorer, copy the C:SetupAdobe Reader XI folder to the E:SourcesSoftwareAdobe folder.
segment.target: On CM01, using File Explorer, copy the C:SetupAdobe Reader XI folder to the E:SourcesSoftwareAdobe folder.

segment.source: Using the Configuration Manager Console, in the Software Library workspace, expand Application Management.
segment.target: Using the Configuration Manager Console, in the Software Library workspace, expand Application Management.

segment.source: Right-click Applications and select Folder / Create Folder.
segment.target: Right-click Applications and select Folder / Create Folder.

segment.source: Assign the name OSD.
segment.target: Assign the name OSD.

segment.source: Right-click the OSD folder, and select Create Application.
segment.target: Right-click the OSD folder, and select Create Application.

segment.source: In the Create Application Wizard, on the General page, use the following settings:
segment.target: In the Create Application Wizard, on the General page, use the following settings:

segment.source: Automatically detect information about this application from installation files
segment.target: Automatically detect information about this application from installation files

segment.source: Type: Windows Installer (.msi file)
segment.target: Type: Windows Installer (.msi file)

segment.source: Location: CM01Sources$SoftwareAdobeAdobe Reader XI
segment.target: Location: CM01Sources$SoftwareAdobeAdobe Reader XI

segment.source: AdbeRdr11000enUS.msi
segment.target: AdbeRdr11000enUS.msi

segment.source: figure 19
segment.target: figure 19

segment.source: Figure 19.
segment.target: Figure 19.

segment.source: The Create Application Wizard.
segment.target: The Create Application Wizard.

segment.source: Click Next, and wait while Configuration Manager parses the MSI file.
segment.target: Click Next, and wait while Configuration Manager parses the MSI file.

segment.source: On the Import Information page, review the information and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Import Information page, review the information and then click Next.

segment.source: On the General Information page, name the application Adobe Reader XI - OSD Install, click Next twice, and then click Close.
segment.target: On the General Information page, name the application Adobe Reader XI - OSD Install, click Next twice, and then click Close.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Since it is not possible to reference an application deployment type in the task sequence, you should have a single deployment type for applications deployed by the task sequence.
segment.target: Since it is not possible to reference an application deployment type in the task sequence, you should have a single deployment type for applications deployed by the task sequence.

segment.source: If you are deploying applications via both the task sequence and normal application deployment, and you have multiple deployment types, you should have two applications of the same software.
segment.target: If you are deploying applications via both the task sequence and normal application deployment, and you have multiple deployment types, you should have two applications of the same software.

segment.source: In this section, you add the "OSD Install" suffix to applications that are deployed via the task sequence.
segment.target: In this section, you add the "OSD Install" suffix to applications that are deployed via the task sequence.

segment.source: If using packages, you can still reference both package and program in the task sequence.
segment.target: If using packages, you can still reference both package and program in the task sequence.

segment.source: figure 20
segment.target: figure 20

segment.source: Figure 20.
segment.target: Figure 20.

segment.source: Add the "OSD Install" suffix to the application name.
segment.target: Add the "OSD Install" suffix to the application name.

segment.source: In the Applications node, select the Adobe Reader XI - OSD Install application, and click Properties on the ribbon bar.
segment.target: In the Applications node, select the Adobe Reader XI - OSD Install application, and click Properties on the ribbon bar.

segment.source: In the General Information tab, select the Allow this application to be installed from the Install Application task sequence action without being deployed check box, and click OK.
segment.target: In the General Information tab, select the Allow this application to be installed from the Install Application task sequence action without being deployed check box, and click OK.
